reviews.text: our friend had booked two nights at the Savoy park for a treat. This was her first visit to Scotland and she was very excited about the hotel as it looked great on the internet. On arrival the receptionist booked her in and did so by sitting behind a desk and not even smiling! Room was well decorated but very dusty. Public areas could have done with a good clean. Kettle could not be used as dirty water had been left in the bottom. On the plus side my friend said the breakfast was nice. She won't be back to stay though!
reviews.title: Nice place to visit but not to good to stay

reviews.text: very pleasant and friendly staff. had a voucher deal for the 1 night , well worth the visit ..
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a last little treat for my son and his friend before we went back to school the next day .
reviews.title: Very enjoyable DB&D stay - over-delivered, excellent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: they also enjoyed the garden as they played on the rope swing they had a ball ..
reviews.title: really good

reviews.text: Stayed here one night, mid-week on a fairly low priced voucher deal - so did not expect too much. So, all the more pleasing then to find the Savoy Park over-deliver on almost all fronts.
reviews.title: Only called in for dinner; great value for a good meal

reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay in the hotel & we had a great time. Can't understand why anyone wouldn't enjoy staying here!
reviews.title: Lovely jubbly xXx

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked one of the executive suites and it was lovely and spacious. Rooms were very clean & had everything you need. Lovely big bath & separate shower. Anything else you needed, all you had to do was ask & the staff brought if straight to you. Yes the decor is not that of a hotel just built in 2012, but certainly not "dated". It's traditional, with a wee bit of Scottish charm. The building itself is beautiful, front & back.
reviews.title: Good food, gorgeous gardens, close to seafront

reviews.text: We eat in the hotel on the Friday & the food was delicious. Great choice and not expensive at all. The staff were lovely too & friendly. Breakfast was buffet style with your eggs cooked as you wished. Lovely.
reviews.title: Wonderful Celebration

reviews.text: The location was just perfect! 10 minute walk from town centre & 5 minute walk to the gorgeous award winning Ayr beach. Nice & quiet surrounding area. What more can you ask for?
reviews.title: Great food and superb value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, when we booked our room, I was informed there was a wedding on the Saturday night and that of course there would be music etc. We did think at first it would be quite noisy on the sat, we did not hear a thing from our room. So even with a wedding on, you are not disturbed at all. And the staff didn't forget about us either.
reviews.title: thanks but no thanks

reviews.text: Our daughter recently had a wedding at the hotel. The arrangements went very easily largely because the staff were extremely helpful, Nothing was a problem and they were very keen to offer advise and assistance.
reviews.title: Lovely venue for weddings, Excellent Staff and Service

reviews.text: The wedding and reception was also very enjoyable even although the water supply to the hotel was off due to a major burst pipe elsewhere in the area. The owner however made me aware as soon as possible which allowed us to advise everyone at the wedding. This was totally outwith the fault of the hotel. thankfully the water was only off for a couple of hours.
reviews.title: Great Wedding Venue

reviews.text: The meal was very good and several guests commented on its quality.
reviews.title: "Wedding"

reviews.text: The gardens are made for such an event and thankfully the weather was good which always helps.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with exceptional service

reviews.text: The staff were very attentive and helpful throughout the day and can be congratulated on their service, the owner should be proud to have such good staff.
reviews.title: Perfect Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went along last night for the first time for dinner. A nice hotel with a bit of character to it. They have a 2 for 1 priced menu for the mains, looked like great value. We went for the set priced meal at around £14.50 for 2 courses, £17.00 for 3 courses. No disappointments with the food, and the wine was excellent.
reviews.title: Rustic Ayrshire Charm

reviews.text: Service was friendly and attentive. Seemed to be more mature diners present, don't think I'd take the kids along in the evening, although they have superb gardens and a kids play area so good for a special lunch occasion with the extended family and the weans.
reviews.title: Excellent Wedding Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all - a great evening.
reviews.title: Beautiful garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We attended a family wedding here on Saturday 21 July 2012. form the minute we checked in until we checked out all I can say was it was an excellent experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The wedding day was fantastic, the food service, gardens were all first class,our room was excellent, at first I thought the rooms would be small, but was pleasantly surprised and astounded at the size of our family room, again it was spotless, I challenege any one to find dust, very very comfortable, and had a great view of the gardens.
reviews.title: All day wedding
